com.ikanow.aleph2.data_model.interfaces.data_import

Interface IHarvestContext

  • All Superinterfaces:
    IUnderlyingService

    public interface IHarvestContext
extends IUnderlyingService
    A context library that is always passed to the IHarvestTechnology module and can also be passed to the harvest library processing (TODO (ALEPH-4): need to document how, ie copy JARs into external classpath and call ContextUtils.getHarvestContext)
    Author:
    acp

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void emergencyDisableBucket(Optional<DataBucketBean> bucket)
      (HarvestTechnology/HarvestModule) Requests that the bucket be suspended - in addition to changing the bucket state, this will result in a call to IHarvestTechnologyModule.onSuspend
      void emergencyQuarantineBucket(Optional<DataBucketBean> bucket, String quarantine_duration)
      (HarvestTechnology/HarvestModule) Requests that the bucket be suspended for the specified duration - in addition to changing the bucket state, this will result in a call to IHarvestTechnologyModule.onSuspend
      void emitObject(Optional<DataBucketBean> bucket, fj.data.Either<com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonNode,Map<String,Object>> object)
      (HarvestModule only) For output modules for the particular technology to output objects reasonably efficient, if an output service is not available
      CompletableFuture<?> flushBatchOutput(Optional<DataBucketBean> bucket)
      (HarvestModule only) Flushes any pending batch output, eg before a process exits
      Optional<DataBucketBean> getBucket()
      (HarvestTechnology/HarvestModule) Returns the specified bucket
      <S> ICrudService<S> getBucketObjectStore(Class<S> clazz, Optional<DataBucketBean> bucket, Optional<String> collection, Optional<AssetStateDirectoryBean.StateDirectoryType> type)
      (HarvestTechnology/HarvestModule) Returns an object repository that the harvester/module can use to store arbitrary internal state.
      CompletableFuture<DataBucketStatusBean> getBucketStatus(Optional<DataBucketBean> bucket)
      (HarvestTechnology/HarvestModule) Returns the status bean for the specified bucket
      String getFinalOutputLocation(Optional<DataBucketBean> bucket)
      (HarvestTechnology/HarvestModule) Once files are moved/written (preferably atomically) into this path, they become owned by the import manager and should no longer be modified by the harvest module
      <S> ICrudService<S> getGlobalHarvestTechnologyObjectStore(Class<S> clazz, Optional<String> collection)
      (HarvestTechnology/HarvestModule) Get the global (ie harvest technology-specific _not_ bucket-specific) object data store
      List<String> getHarvestContextLibraries(Optional<Set<scala.Tuple2<Class<? extends IUnderlyingService>,Optional<String>>>> services)
      (HarvesterTechnology only) A list of JARs that can be copied to an external process (eg Hadoop job) to provide the result client access to this context (and other services) Can't call getHarvestContextSignature/getHarvestContextLibraries with different 'services' parameter Can't call getUnderlyingArtefacts without having called getHarvestContextSignature/getHarvestContextLibraries
      String getHarvestContextSignature(Optional<DataBucketBean> bucket, Optional<Set<scala.Tuple2<Class<? extends IUnderlyingService>,Optional<String>>>> services)
      (HarvesterTechnology only) This string should be passed into ContextUtils.getHarvestContext to retrieve this class from within external clients Can't call getHarvestContextSignature/getHarvestContextLibraries with different 'services' parameter Can't call getUnderlyingArtefacts without having called getHarvestContextSignature/getHarvestContextLibraries
      CompletableFuture<Map<String,String>> getHarvestLibraries(Optional<DataBucketBean> bucket)
      (HarvesterTechnology only) For each library defined by the bucket.harvest_configs, returns a FileSystem path
      Map<String,SharedLibraryBean> getLibraryConfigs()
      (HarvestTechnology/HarvestModule) Returns the library beans optionally specified in the harvest config's module_name_or_id/library_name_or_ids The libraries bean can be used together with the CoreManagementDb (getPerLibraryState) to store/retrieve state, and to get entry points into modular functionality To convert the library_config field to a bean, just use Optional.ofNullable(_context.getLibraryConfig().library_config()).map(j -> BeanTemplateUtils.from(j).get()) This can also be used to obtain BucketUtils.getStreamingEntryPoint or BucketUtils.getBatchEntryPoint or BucketUtils.getEntryPoint
      <S> Optional<ICrudService<S>> getLibraryObjectStore(Class<S> clazz, String name_or_id, Optional<String> collection)
      (HarvestTechnology/HarvestModule) Get the global (ie module library-specific _not_ bucket-specific) object data store, if a module has been specified
      IServiceContext getServiceContext()
      (HarvesterModule only) Returns context to return a service - for external clients, the corresponding library JAR must have been copied into the class file (path given by getHarvestContextLibraries) (NOTE: harvester technology modules do not need this, they can access the service context directly via the @Inject annotation)
      SharedLibraryBean getTechnologyLibraryConfig()
      (HarvestTechnology/HarvestModule) Returns the library bean that provided the user callback currently being executed This library bean can be used together with the CoreManagementDb (getPerLibraryState) to store/retrieve state To convert the library_config field to a bean, just use Optional.ofNullable(_context.getLibraryConfig().library_config()).map(j -> BeanTemplateUtils.from(j).get())
      String getTempOutputLocation(Optional<DataBucketBean> bucket)
      (HarvestTechnology/HarvestModule) A safe location into which temp data can be written without being accessed by the data import manager It is the responsibility of the harvest technology module to keep this area clean however.
      void initializeNewContext(String signature)
      (Should never be called by clients) this is used by the infrastructure to set up external contexts
      void logStatusForBucketOwner(Optional<DataBucketBean> bucket, BasicMessageBean message)
      (HarvestTechnology/HarvestModule) Calling this function logs a status message into he DataBucketStatusBean that is visible to the user
      void logStatusForBucketOwner(Optional<DataBucketBean> bucket, BasicMessageBean message, boolean roll_up_duplicates)
      (HarvestTechnology/HarvestModule) Calling this function logs a status message into he DataBucketStatusBean that is visible to the user Note that the behavior of the context if called on another bucket than the one currently being processed is undefined
      void sendObjectToStreamingPipeline(Optional<DataBucketBean> bucket, fj.data.Either<com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonNode,Map<String,Object>> object)
      (HarvestModule only) For (near) real time harvests emit the object to the enrichment/alerting pipeline If no streaming enrichment pipeline is set up this will broadcast the object to listening streaming analytics/access - if not picked up, it will be dropped

      • Methods inherited from interface com.ikanow.aleph2.data_model.interfaces.shared_services.IUnderlyingService

        getUnderlyingArtefacts, getUnderlyingPlatformDriver

    • Method Detail

      • getServiceContext

        IServiceContext getServiceContext()
        (HarvesterModule only) Returns context to return a service - for external clients, the corresponding library JAR must have been copied into the class file (path given by getHarvestContextLibraries) (NOTE: harvester technology modules do not need this, they can access the service context directly via the @Inject annotation)
        Returns:
        the service context

      • sendObjectToStreamingPipeline

        void sendObjectToStreamingPipeline(Optional<DataBucketBean> bucket,
                                   fj.data.Either<com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonNode,Map<String,Object>> object)
        (HarvestModule only) For (near) real time harvests emit the object to the enrichment/alerting pipeline If no streaming enrichment pipeline is set up this will broadcast the object to listening streaming analytics/access - if not picked up, it will be dropped
        Parameters:
        bucket - An optional bucket - if there is no ambiguity in the bucket then Optional.empty() can be passed (Note that the behavior of the context if called on another bucket than the one currently being processed is undefined)
        object - the object to emit represented by either Jackson JsonNode or a generic map-of-objects

      • emitObject

        void emitObject(Optional<DataBucketBean> bucket,
                fj.data.Either<com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonNode,Map<String,Object>> object)
        (HarvestModule only) For output modules for the particular technology to output objects reasonably efficient, if an output service is not available
        Parameters:
        bucket - An optional bucket - if there is no ambiguity in the bucket then Optional.empty() can be passed (Note that the behavior of the context if called on another bucket than the one currently being processed is undefined)
        object - the object to emit represented by either Jackson JsonNode or a generic map-of-objects

      • flushBatchOutput

        CompletableFuture<?> flushBatchOutput(Optional<DataBucketBean> bucket)
        (HarvestModule only) Flushes any pending batch output, eg before a process exits
        Parameters:
        bucket - An optional bucket - if there is no ambiguity in the bucket then Optional.empty() can be passed (Note that the behavior of the context if called on another bucket than the one currently being processed is undefined)
        Returns:
        a undefined future that completes when the batch output completes

      • getTempOutputLocation

        String getTempOutputLocation(Optional<DataBucketBean> bucket)
        (HarvestTechnology/HarvestModule) A safe location into which temp data can be written without being accessed by the data import manager It is the responsibility of the harvest technology module to keep this area clean however.
        Parameters:
        bucket - An optional bucket - if there is no ambiguity in the bucket then Optional.empty() can be passed (Note that the behavior of the context if called on another bucket than the one currently being processed is undefined)
        Returns:
        the location in a string format that makes sense to the IAccessService

      • getFinalOutputLocation

        String getFinalOutputLocation(Optional<DataBucketBean> bucket)
        (HarvestTechnology/HarvestModule) Once files are moved/written (preferably atomically) into this path, they become owned by the import manager and should no longer be modified by the harvest module
        Parameters:
        bucket - An optional bucket - if there is no ambiguity in the bucket then Optional.empty() can be passed (Note that the behavior of the context if called on another bucket than the one currently being processed is undefined)
        Returns:
        the location in a string format that makes sense to the IStorageService

      • getHarvestContextLibraries

        List<String> getHarvestContextLibraries(Optional<Set<scala.Tuple2<Class<? extends IUnderlyingService>,Optional<String>>>> services)
        (HarvesterTechnology only) A list of JARs that can be copied to an external process (eg Hadoop job) to provide the result client access to this context (and other services) Can't call getHarvestContextSignature/getHarvestContextLibraries with different 'services' parameter Can't call getUnderlyingArtefacts without having called getHarvestContextSignature/getHarvestContextLibraries
        Parameters:
        services - an optional set of service classes (with optionally service name - not needed unless a non-default service is needed) that are needed (only the libraries needed for the context is provided otherwise)
        Returns:
        the path (in a format that makes sense to IStorageService)

      • getHarvestContextSignature

        String getHarvestContextSignature(Optional<DataBucketBean> bucket,
                                  Optional<Set<scala.Tuple2<Class<? extends IUnderlyingService>,Optional<String>>>> services)
        (HarvesterTechnology only) This string should be passed into ContextUtils.getHarvestContext to retrieve this class from within external clients Can't call getHarvestContextSignature/getHarvestContextLibraries with different 'services' parameter Can't call getUnderlyingArtefacts without having called getHarvestContextSignature/getHarvestContextLibraries
        Parameters:
        bucket - An optional bucket - if there is no ambiguity in the bucket then Optional.empty() can be passed (Note that the behavior of the context if called on another bucket than the one currently being processed is undefined)
        services - an optional set of service classes (with optionally service name - not needed unless a non-default service is needed) that are needed (only the libraries needed for the context is provided otherwise)
        Returns:
        an opaque string that can be passed into ContextUtils.getHarvestContext

      • getHarvestLibraries

        CompletableFuture<Map<String,String>> getHarvestLibraries(Optional<DataBucketBean> bucket)
        (HarvesterTechnology only) For each library defined by the bucket.harvest_configs, returns a FileSystem path
        Parameters:
        bucket - An optional bucket - if there is no ambiguity in the bucket then Optional.empty() can be passed (Note that the behavior of the context if called on another bucket than the one currently being processed is undefined)
        Returns:
        A Future containing a map of filesystem paths with key both the name and id of the library

      • getGlobalHarvestTechnologyObjectStore

        <S> ICrudService<S> getGlobalHarvestTechnologyObjectStore(Class<S> clazz,
                                                          Optional<String> collection)
        (HarvestTechnology/HarvestModule) Get the global (ie harvest technology-specific _not_ bucket-specific) object data store
        Parameters:
        clazz - The class of the bean or object type desired (needed so the repo can reason about the type when deciding on optimizations etc)
        collection - - arbitrary string, enables the user to split the per bucket state into multiple independent collections. If left empty then returns a directory of existing collections (clazz has to be AssetStateDirectoryBean.class)
        Returns:
        a generic object repository visible to all users of this harvest technology

      • getLibraryObjectStore

        <S> Optional<ICrudService<S>> getLibraryObjectStore(Class<S> clazz,
                                                    String name_or_id,
                                                    Optional<String> collection)
        (HarvestTechnology/HarvestModule) Get the global (ie module library-specific _not_ bucket-specific) object data store, if a module has been specified
        Parameters:
        clazz - The class of the bean or object type desired (needed so the repo can reason about the type when deciding on optimizations etc)
        module_name_or_id - - the name specified in the harvest configuration
        collection - - arbitrary string, enables the user to split the per bucket state into multiple independent collections. If left empty then returns a directory of existing collections (clazz has to be AssetStateDirectoryBean.class)
        Returns:
        a generic object repository visible to all users of this module

      • getBucketObjectStore

        <S> ICrudService<S> getBucketObjectStore(Class<S> clazz,
                                         Optional<DataBucketBean> bucket,
                                         Optional<String> collection,
                                         Optional<AssetStateDirectoryBean.StateDirectoryType> type)
        (HarvestTechnology/HarvestModule) Returns an object repository that the harvester/module can use to store arbitrary internal state.
        Parameters:
        clazz - The class of the bean or object type desired (needed so the repo can reason about the type when deciding on optimizations etc)
        bucket - An optional bucket - if there is no ambiguity in the bucket then Optional.empty() can be passed (Note that the behavior of the context if called on another bucket than the one currently being processed is undefined)
        collection - - arbitrary string, enables the user to split the per bucket state into multiple independent collections. If left empty then returns a directory of existing collections (clazz has to be AssetStateDirectoryBean.class)
        type - - if left blank then points to the harvest type, else can retrieve other types of object store (shared_library - bucket is then ignored, enrichment, or analytics)
        Returns:
        a generic object repository

      • getBucket

        Optional<DataBucketBean> getBucket()
        (HarvestTechnology/HarvestModule) Returns the specified bucket
        Returns:
        The bucket that this job is running for, or Optional.empty() if that is ambiguous

      • getTechnologyLibraryConfig

        SharedLibraryBean getTechnologyLibraryConfig()
        (HarvestTechnology/HarvestModule) Returns the library bean that provided the user callback currently being executed This library bean can be used together with the CoreManagementDb (getPerLibraryState) to store/retrieve state To convert the library_config field to a bean, just use Optional.ofNullable(_context.getLibraryConfig().library_config()).map(j -> BeanTemplateUtils.from(j).get())
        Returns:
        the library bean that provided the user callback currently being executed

      • getLibraryConfigs

        Map<String,SharedLibraryBean> getLibraryConfigs()
        (HarvestTechnology/HarvestModule) Returns the library beans optionally specified in the harvest config's module_name_or_id/library_name_or_ids The libraries bean can be used together with the CoreManagementDb (getPerLibraryState) to store/retrieve state, and to get entry points into modular functionality To convert the library_config field to a bean, just use Optional.ofNullable(_context.getLibraryConfig().library_config()).map(j -> BeanTemplateUtils.from(j).get()) This can also be used to obtain BucketUtils.getStreamingEntryPoint or BucketUtils.getBatchEntryPoint or BucketUtils.getEntryPoint
        Returns:
        the library bean that provided the user callback currently being executed

      • getBucketStatus

        CompletableFuture<DataBucketStatusBean> getBucketStatus(Optional<DataBucketBean> bucket)
        (HarvestTechnology/HarvestModule) Returns the status bean for the specified bucket
        Parameters:
        bucket - An optional bucket - if there is no ambiguity in the bucket then Optional.empty() can be passed (Note that the behavior of the context if called on another bucket than the one currently being processed is undefined)
        Returns:
        A Future containing a bean containing the harvests state and status

      • logStatusForBucketOwner

        void logStatusForBucketOwner(Optional<DataBucketBean> bucket,
                             BasicMessageBean message,
                             boolean roll_up_duplicates)
        (HarvestTechnology/HarvestModule) Calling this function logs a status message into he DataBucketStatusBean that is visible to the user Note that the behavior of the context if called on another bucket than the one currently being processed is undefined
        Parameters:
        bucket - An optional bucket - if there is no ambiguity in the bucket then Optional.empty() can be passed (Note that the behavior of the context if called on another bucket than the one currently being processed is undefined)
        message - The message to log
        roll_up_duplicates - if set (default: true) then identical messages are not logged separately

      • logStatusForBucketOwner

        void logStatusForBucketOwner(Optional<DataBucketBean> bucket,
                             BasicMessageBean message)
        (HarvestTechnology/HarvestModule) Calling this function logs a status message into he DataBucketStatusBean that is visible to the user
        Parameters:
        bucket - An optional bucket - if there is no ambiguity in the bucket then Optional.empty() can be passed (Note that the behavior of the context if called on another bucket than the one currently being processed is undefined)
        The - message to log (duplicates are "rolled up")

      • emergencyDisableBucket

        void emergencyDisableBucket(Optional<DataBucketBean> bucket)
        (HarvestTechnology/HarvestModule) Requests that the bucket be suspended - in addition to changing the bucket state, this will result in a call to IHarvestTechnologyModule.onSuspend
        Parameters:
        bucket - An optional bucket - if there is no ambiguity in the bucket then Optional.empty() can be passed (Note that the behavior of the context if called on another bucket than the one currently being processed is undefined)

      • emergencyQuarantineBucket

        void emergencyQuarantineBucket(Optional<DataBucketBean> bucket,
                               String quarantine_duration)
        (HarvestTechnology/HarvestModule) Requests that the bucket be suspended for the specified duration - in addition to changing the bucket state, this will result in a call to IHarvestTechnologyModule.onSuspend
        Parameters:
        bucket - An optional bucket - if there is no ambiguity in the bucket then Optional.empty() can be passed (Note that the behavior of the context if called on another bucket than the one currently being processed is undefined)
        quarantineDuration - A string representing the duration for which to quarantine the data (eg "1 hour", "2 days", "3600")

      • initializeNewContext

        void initializeNewContext(String signature)
        (Should never be called by clients) this is used by the infrastructure to set up external contexts
        Parameters:
        signature - the string returned from getHarvestContextSignature
